    Introduction

    Welcome to the Kittn API! You can use our API to access Kittn API endpoints, which can get information on various cats, kittns, and breeds in our database.

    We have language bindings in Shell. You can view code examples in the dark area to the right.

    This example API documentation page was created with Slate. Feel free to edit it and use it as a base for your own API's documentation.

    Authentication

    To authorize, use this code:

    # With bash, you can just pass the correct header with each request
curl "api_endpoint_here" \
  -H "Authorization: meowmeowmeow"

    Make sure to replace meowmeowmeow with your API key.

    Kittn uses API keys to allow access to the API. You can register a new Kittn API key at our developer portal.

    Kittn expects for the API key to be included in all API requests to the server in a header that looks like the following:

    Authorization: meowmeowmeow

    You must replace meowmeowmeow with your personal API key.

    Host Domain

    Error Path

    
curl -X GET "http://example.com/error" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer {token}"

    The above command(s) returns JSON structured like this:

    {
 "message": "you have made a bad request",
 "code": 400,
 "status": "Bad Request"
}

    This route returns an error depending on given id (none, 1, or 2)

    HTTP Request

    GET http://example.com/error

    Query Parameters

    Parameter Required Description
    id false use none, 1 or 2 for different errors

    Root Path

    
curl -X GET "http://example.com/" 

curl -X POST "http://example.com/" 

curl -X PUT "http://example.com/" 

curl -X PATCH "http://example.com/" 

curl -X CONNECT "http://example.com/" 

curl -X OPTIONS "http://example.com/" 

curl -X TRACE "http://example.com/"

    The above command(s) returns JSON structured like this:

    {
 "app_name": "rest-api",
 "build_info": {
  "build": "go1.18.4",
  "version": "4f34cc3",
  "build_time": "2022-07-28_18:06:37"
 }
}

    The root path returns the api name and version.

    HTTP Request

    GET http://example.com/

    POST http://example.com/

    PUT http://example.com/

    PATCH http://example.com/

    CONNECT http://example.com/

    OPTIONS http://example.com/

    TRACE http://example.com/

    Testing Post Route

    
curl -X POST "http://example.com/testing" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer {token}"\
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'\ 
  --raw-data '{
 "id": 123,
 "name": "Alex Doe",
 "float": 123.456,
 "map": {
  "test": "value",
  "test2": 432
 },
 "array": [
  "string value",
  123.12,
  {
   "key": "value"
  },
  6575
 ]
}'

    The body of the request should be JSON and structured like this:

    {
 "id": 123,
 "name": "Alex Doe",
 "float": 123.456,
 "map": {
  "test": "value",
  "test2": 432
 },
 "array": [
  "string value",
  123.12,
  {
   "key": "value"
  },
  6575
 ]
}

    The above command(s) returns JSON structured like this:

    {
 "id": 123,
 "name": "Alex Doe",
 "float": 123.456,
 "map": {
  "test": "value",
  "test2": 432
 },
 "array": [
  "string value",
  123.12,
  {
   "key": "value"
  },
  6575
 ]
}

    This is for testing post requests

    HTTP Request

    POST http://example.com/testing

    • Content-Type: application/json

    JSON Fields for Request Body

    Field Name Required Description
    id false
    name false
    float false
    map false
    array false

    Kittns V1

    Get a Specific Kittn

    
curl -X GET "http://example.com/v1/kittns/{id}" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer {token}"

    The above command(s) returns JSON structured like this:

    {
 "id": 1,
 "name": "Fluffums",
 "breed": "calico",
 "fluffiness": 6,
 "cuteness": 7
}

    This endpoint retrieves a specific kittn

    HTTP Request

    GET http://example.com/v1/kittns/{id}

    URL Parameters

    Parameter Description
    id the id for a kittn

    Delete a Specific Kittn

    
curl -X DELETE "http://example.com/v1/kittns/{id}" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer {token}"

    This endpoint deletes a specific kittn

    HTTP Request

    DELETE http://example.com/v1/kittns/{id}

    URL Parameters

    Parameter Description
    id the id for a kittn

    Add a New Kittn

    
curl -X POST "http://example.com/v1/kittns" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer {token}"\
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json'\ 
  --raw-data '{
 "name": "Stealth",
 "breed": "Siamese",
 "fluffiness": 2,
 "cuteness": 3
}'

    The body of the request should be JSON and structured like this:

    {
 "name": "Stealth",
 "breed": "Siamese",
 "fluffiness": 2,
 "cuteness": 3
}

    The above command(s) returns JSON structured like this:

    {
 "id": 3,
 "name": "Stealth",
 "breed": "Siamese",
 "fluffiness": 2,
 "cuteness": 3
}

    This endpoint adds a new kittn

    HTTP Request

    POST http://example.com/v1/kittns

    • Content-Type: application/json

    JSON Fields for Request Body

    Field Name Required Description
    name true the kittn's name
    breed true the kittn's breed
    fluffiness false the fluffiness factor
    cuteness false the cuteness factor

    Get All Kittns

    
curl -X GET "http://example.com/v1/kittns" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer {token}"

    The above command(s) returns JSON structured like this:

    [
 {
  "id": 1,
  "name": "Fluffums",
  "breed": "calico",
  "fluffiness": 6,
  "cuteness": 7
 },
 {
  "id": 2,
  "name": "Max",
  "breed": "calico",
  "fluffiness": 5,
  "cuteness": 10
 }
]

    This endpoint retrieves all kittns

    HTTP Request

    GET http://example.com/v1/kittns

    Errors

    This API uses the following error codes:

    Error Code Meaning
    400 Bad Request -- Your request is invalid.
    401 Unauthorized -- Your API key is wrong.
    403 Forbidden -- Unauthorized
    404 Not Found -- The specified kittn could not be found.
    405 Method Not Allowed -- You tried to access an endpoint with an invalid method.
    406 Not Acceptable -- The target resource does not have a representation that's acceptable to the user agent
    410 Gone -- The resource requested has been removed from our servers.
    418 I'm a teapot.
    429 Too Many Requests -- Rate limits applied ! Slow down!
    500 Internal Server Error -- We had a problem with our server. Try again later.
    503 Service Unavailable -- We're temporarily offline for maintenance. Please try again later.
    bash
